result.execSummary:
The defendant Paul A Lombardi was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. On one or more other charges, Paul A Lombardi was found not guilty. These charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Paul A Lombardi is presumed innocent of the not guilty charges.

  • Paul A Lombardi was found guilty of Strangulation and Suffocation [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse, Repeater, Domestic Abuse Repeater], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.235(1).
  • Paul A Lombardi was found guilty of Strangulation and Suffocation [Modifiers: Repeater, Domestic Abuse Repeater, Domestic Abuse], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.235(1).
  • Paul A Lombardi was found guilty of Battery - Domestic Abuse Repeater [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse, Repeater, Domestic Abuse Repeater], an unclassified felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • Paul A Lombardi was found guilty of Battery - Domestic Abuse Repeater [Modifiers: Repeater, Domestic Abuse Repeater, Domestic Abuse], an unclassified felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • Paul A Lombardi was found guilty of Battery - Domestic Abuse Repeater [Modifiers: Repeater, Domestic Abuse Repeater, Domestic Abuse], an unclassified felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • Paul A Lombardi was found guilty of Disorderly Conduct - Domestic Abuse Repeater [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse, Domestic Abuse Repeater, Repeater], an unclassified felony, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).
  • Paul A Lombardi was found guilty of Disorderly Conduct - Domestic Abuse Repeater [Modifiers: Repeater, Domestic Abuse Repeater, Domestic Abuse], an unclassified felony, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).
  • Paul A Lombardi was found guilty of Criminal Trespass to Dwelling - Dom Abuse Repeater [Modifiers: Repeater, Domestic Abuse Repeater, Domestic Abuse], an unclassified felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.14.
  • Paul A Lombardi was found guilty of Disorderly Conduct - Domestic Abuse Repeater [Modifiers: Repeater, Domestic Abuse Repeater, Domestic Abuse], an unclassified felony, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Sentencing hearing on August 4, 2017 at 02:00 pm.

Defendant in court with Attorney Jeffrey William Jensen.  Allison E. Cogbill and Matthew Moeser appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  8:34 Thursday, June 8, 2017on the record.  Domestic Abuse Repeater issue addressed.  Ex 8 marked, offered & recd, but objected to by DE to go back to jury.  Jurors brought into courtroom at 8:43.  State calls KC; duly sworn and testified.  Direct by DA Moeser 8:45.  Ex 9 marked, offered & recd w/o objection.  Cross exam by Atty Jensen 9:01.  Redirect by State 9:04.  Witness excused. Jurors and Court recess while State awaits next witness.  Court resumes at 9:16 and jurors brought back in.  State calls KK; duly sworn & testified.  Direct by ADA Cogbill 9:19.  Witness IDs DE.  Cross exam by Atty Jensen 9:21.  Redirect by the State 9:26.  Witness excused & released from subpoena.  State rests.  DE wants to make motions, jury recesses 9:29.  DE moves to dismiss Cts 2, portion of 7, and 10.  State argues; defense rebuttal.  Motions to dismiss are denied by Court.  Colloquy with DE.  DE chooses to testify.  DE stipulates that he has prior domestic abuse convictions, hence prohibiting the State from presenting any evidence on that.  State accepts stip.  Court requests signed stip & order be filed.  Jury returned 9:49.  Atty Jensen calls Defendant PL; direct by Atty Jensen.  Cross by ADA Moeser 10:24.  DE has a motion.  Jury recesses 10:29.  DE motions for a mistrial.  State argues.  Rebuttal by DE and requests dismissal w/prejudice.  Ct denies motion.  Jury returns 10:35.  Cont cross by State.  Witness excused.  DE rests 10:48.  Jury excused until 1pm. Morning recess for court until 10:45.  Court resumes at 11:25 to address prior convictions stipulation and JIs.  Court does colloquy with DE who waives jury trial re: prior convictions. Court recesses for lunch until 1:20.  Court resumes at 1:27.  Jurors brought back into courtroom 1:31 pm.  Closing argument by DA Moeser 1:34; Atty Jensen 1:51.  Rebuttal by ADA Cogbill 2:09.  Ct gives final jury instructions 2:23.  Alternate jurors selected, bailiff sworn & jury sent for deliberation 3:14.  Ct recesses to await jury deliberation.  4:50 pm Court resumes to address jury question #2.  Adjourned 4:53 to await jury question/deliberation.  Court resumes 7:59 to address question #3.  Adjourned 8:02.  On the record at 9:04 to address jury question #4.  Adjourned 9:06.  Court resumes at 9:53 pm to address question #5.  Adjourned at 9:56.  Jurors reached a verdict.  Court resumes 2:07 am, jurors brought back in.  Verdict given to Judge.  Judge reads verdicts for all 13 counts.  Jurors polled.  Court accepts verdicts.  Jurors released 2:17 am.  State moves to revoke bail and enter JOCs for guilty verdicts.  DE moves for acquittal of NG counts and objects to bond revocation.  Judgments entered on the record.  Ct finds it appropriate to grant States motion to revoke bail.  Court orders PSI.  SEH to be scheduled after that.  Ct adjourned 2:21 am.  DE taken into custody on revoked bail.

Defendant in court with Attorney Jeffrey William Jensen.  Allison E. Cogbill appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  8:32 on the record.  Preliminary issues discussed.  Jurors brought into courtroom and sworn at 8:45.  Ct gives preliminary instructions. Opening statement by ADA Cogbill 8:55.  DE waives opening statement.  State calls EA; duly sworn and testified.  Direct by DA Moeser 9:05.  Witness IDd defendant.  Ex 1, 2 marked, offered & recd over objections.  Ex 3, 4, 5 marked, offered & recd w/o objection.  Ex 6 marked, offered & denied. Morning recess until 10:45.  Juror 12 brought in for voir dire and excused back to jury room.  Jurors brought back into courtroom 10:54.  Cross exam by Atty Jensen.  Redirect by State. Recross by Atty Jensen.  Witness excused 11:45.  Court recesses for lunch until 12:45.  Jurors brought back into courtroom 12:50 pm.  State calls EG; duly sworn and testified.  Direct by ADA Cogbill.  Ex 7 marked, offered & recd over objections.  Cross by Atty Jensen.  Redirect by State.  Witness excused & released from subpoena.  State calls CF; duly sworn & testified.  Direct by State 1:19.  Witness IDs DE.  Cross exam by Atty Jensen.  Redirect by the State.  Witness excused & released from subpoena.  State calls MM; duly sworn & testified.  Direct by State 1:42.  Witness excused.  Jury recessed at 1:47 for counsel discussion. Court recesses until 2:09 and jurors brought back into courtroom.  State calls KS; duly sworn & testified.  Direct by ADA Cogbill.  Cross by Atty Jensen 2:15.  Redirect by State 2:23.  Recross by defense.  Witness excused & released from subpoena.  Jury and court excused until tomorrow at 8:30 am.

Defendant in court with Attorney Jeffrey William Jensen.  Matthew D. Moeser and Allison Cogbill appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  State requests ELMO for Trial.  Bailiff gets jurors 9:21.  Jurors sworn 9:38.  Court gives preliminary instructions.  Jurors called.  9:55 Voir dire by Court.  Voir dire by DA Moeser 10:05.  Voir dire by Atty Jensen 10:18.  Counsel exercises strikes (5 each) 10:43.  Selected jurors called, rest of jury excused. Selected jurors sent with Bailiff to return Wed at 8:30 am.   11:07 MILs and JIs addressed.  11:22 Court adjourned until Wednesday.

Reporter:  Jeanette Sundstrom
Original (Motion Hearing 5/18/2017) filed

Attorney Jeffrey William Jensen in court on behalf of defendant.  Colette Catherine Sampson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  States Other Acts Motion and Defense Motion to Exclude Expert Witness Testimony and Courts Oral Ruling scheduled.  State calls expert witness KC; duly sworn & testified.  Direct by ADA Sampson.  Ex 1, 2, 3 marked, offered & recd.   Cross exam by Atty Jensen.  Court questions witness.  Witness excused.  Parties state positions.  State gives argument for Other Acts motion.  Defense gives argument.  State gives rebuttal.  Court gives oral ruling.  Motion to deny expert testimony is denied; witness is an expert.  States motion to admit other acts is denied.  Court addresses any other issues.
